title: nursery staff save toddler after
story: Nursery staff save toddler after allergic reaction - and send parents warningBaby Dominic Whitham who is nicknamed Doodles, has  known allergens arising from a range of foods and materials such as latex, avocado, milk and beefBaby Doodles with mum Kerri-Louise Image: Kerri-Louise WhithamByDaisy HermanGraeme Murray:,  Apr |comments A warning has been issued after nursery staff saved a one-year-old boy who had a serious allergic reaction.Mum Kerri-Louise Whitham was terried her young boy would have gone into a full anaphylactic shock. Baby Dominic who is nicknamed Doodles, has  known allergens arising from a range of foods and materials such as latex, avocado, milk and beef. He also has breathing problems and neonatal absence syndrome following a morphine addiction because of hi mumaposs disability Staff at Astbury Lane Nursery in Congleton are aware of his health problems and work with his mum to keep him safe. So when a staff member saw a red blotch on his face, they leaped into action.  On Wednesday, Dominic started a new oral medication for an allergy-related skin condition. Just hours after his first dose, he began showing the first signs of a serious allergic reaction. Staff at Astbury Lane Nursery reacted quickly and contacted mum Kerri-Louise, who instructed them to give him allergy medication. They administered the treatment within minutes of the blotch being spotted. Kerri-Louise was called to the nursery after he developed an allergy and could see it was spreading.She told CheshireLive : “I could see straight away that his lips had started swelling, his eyes were puffy, lips were a deep red. I am relaying this back to the GP, I said, ‘He’s had his allergy medication but the symptoms do seem to have spread in the   minutes it has taken me to get there.’“He wasn’t at all fighting for his breath, he just had lots of shallow, quick breathing. The nursery staff, Gemma, had put his hand on his chest, and that is when I noticed his breathing.”  The GP told Kerri-Louise she needed to take baby Dominic to the hospital. Staff remained calm and helped Dominic into his mum’s car, who was planning on driving him to Macclesfield Hospital. “Dominic was kind of smiling but quiet. He wasn’t panicked in any way,” Kerri-Louise said. “Neither were the staff. Because I was on my own, the staff carried him to the car for me and strapped him into the car seat. After getting advice from husband Carl, she decided to call an ambulance to meet them at the house as fear increased of Dominic’s symptoms getting worse.He was starting to look more unwell and was becoming lethargic, and more red blotches and patches of eczema were appearing around his face. When an ambulance arrived, they checked him over and decided to take him to hospital to keep an eye on him as his allergy medication wears off. At just one year old, Dominic knows sign language. He has learned over  dferent signs since he was just two months old. Kerri-Louise explained that she was in a car accident at  which left her left leg paralysed and also resulted in spinal damage. She said: “He was born with a morphine addiction because of my disability. It’s neonatal abstinence syndrome, and when you go into withdrawal, your body shakes and you get angry because you need something that you can’t have. “My older sonhas the same thing. So we did sign language with the both of them because although they can’t speak, they can sign from six or seven months old. “Very handy ones have been ‘hurt’, ‘doctor’ and ‘medicine’. He can do animals and really fun ones as well like ‘monkey’ or ‘dog. But the main things we needed him to know were things like ‘medicine’, that would really help us.” While waiting for treatment, Dominic was signing that his head hurt, signalling to his parents that he possibly had a headache due to the reaction. Sign language is an important part of managing Dominic’s health, and the nursery have not shied away from embracing this. They have learned to understand some of the signs to help accommodate Dominic’s needs. Kerri-Louise said: “The nursery have learned sign language to be able to communicate with him as well. He’s probably been there about six months. He started in their baby room, and the baby staff learned sign language because he had been signing since he was about two months old.” Now Dominic has moved to the baby-toddler room with new staff who have embraced the language. His mum continued: “Within that room, he can actually sign a sentence, he can do two or three signs now. So unfortunately, theyhave got the harder job and they have to learn more signs to keep up with him.” Fortunately, due to the medication being administered so early on in the reaction, Dominic’s symptoms did not progress much further. He was discharged from hospital relatively quickly, and the doctor said that they were ‘lucky’ that the reaction had not been worse. Kerri-Louise said: “She was surprised that his throat didn’t close up on him, it could have been a full anaphylactic shock. But it wasn’t, the reaction paused at face swelling.” She is grateful that the staff were so quick in their reaction, especially nursery worker Olivia. The mum added: “She wasn’t tied with Dominic in any way. He wasn’t her responsibility. She’s gone out of her way to know… all his medication, all his health history. She got to know him that well that she could spot something so quickly and know it was serious. That just says everything about that nursery, they are a million miles ahead. They just treat them like family.” The reaction had the potential to be deadly, as it was completely out-of-the-blue and the symptoms were the “most serious”. But the staff at Astbury Lane Nurseryaposs actions saved baby ‘Doodles’’ le. Kerri-Louise explained that the nursery has been incredible with his allergies, and this incident is just a testament to their care and quality. She said: “When I mentioned his health problems, it was never a problem. Nothing is too much for this nursery, they have made something that was so so dficult at home, such a worry, they made it easy. “When he goes to nursery, I don’t worry, because I know for a fact that they will look after him.” It took a week for Dominic’s symptoms to subside, but the situation could have been a lot worse had the nursery not reacted so fast. Nursery Manager, Kate Smithers, said she is ‘proud’ of the team. She said: “After the girls noticed the mark on Dominic’s face, they instantly reacted by giving him the care and treatment needed. The team are incredible and the way they took control of the situation and knew that something wasn’t right, is a detriment to how seriously they take their role. “From the moment they noticed the mark, to the emergency medication being administered was literally a few minutes. Throughout, they remained calm, focused and worked together as a team to support one another, Dominic and also his mother, Kerri. title: popular uk zoo no longer
story: Paignton Zoo will no longer be home to elephants after beloved animals diePaignton Zoo in Devon used to have two elephants – Asian elephant Gay, who died in , and African elephant Duchess, who died in , but the attraction has announced they will not be replacedDuchess the African elephant died in , and will not be replaced at Paignton Zoo Image: SWNSByCaroline Abbott:,  Apr Updated:,  Apr |comments A UK zoo will no longer keep elephants after admitting it canapost provide the necessary environment for them.Paignton Zoo in Devon used to have two elephants – Asian elephant Gay, who died in , and African elephant Duchess, who died in .The attraction, which is celebrating its th birthday, has confirmed they will not be replaced, Devon Live reports.It said: “Elephants are highly intelligent and have very complex social and behavioural needs. “As much as we loved Duchessand as popular as she was with our visitors, we do not believe that we can provide the necessary environment for elephants here at Paignton.” The zoo added that it continues to support elephant conservation in the wild.  A statement said: “We have been working to protect the Omo Forest Reserve in Nigeria since  and this is one of the last remaining places in Nigeria where forest elephants still survive. “Visitors are therefore still helping protect elephants when they visit our zoo, even though we no longer have any here.” Last year – when there were  elephants in  zoos across the UK – it was reported that keeping elephants in zoos or safari parks would be phased out. Importation of new elephants would be prohibited and the existing population would be allowed to die out naturally. The news delighted campaigners who said that elephants, which are highly intelligent animals, suffer from mental illness in zoos.The RSPCA said it also causes them physical ailments such as crippling arthritis.They only live for an average of  years in captivity, compared with more than  years in the wild, where they live in large herds with highly complex social lives, and some travel hundreds of miles each year. It has been illegal for circuses to keep elephants since January . This legislation would bring an end to more than seven centuries of elephants being kept in captivity in this country. title: prince andrew isnt going away
story: Prince Andrews trying to reinvent himself - but itll only work while Queens aliveWhy would a man so internationally humiliated try to force himself back into public le, wonders Fleet Street Fox Image: Getty ImagesopinionByFleet Street FoxColumnist:,  Apr Updated:,  Apr |commentsHistorians of the future will devote books, doctorates, and entire symposiums to the question of what the hell goes on in Prince Andrewaposs mind.See a dodgy banker  Make friends, holiday, schmooze the girls that seem to always hang around, ignore the child abuse guilty plea, let your ex-we take a loan, then sweat for a decade before you decide to say sorry.See another dodgy banker  Take the money, be schmoozed, ignore questions about his bank going bust, let your ex-we take another loan, let your daughters take cash gts, pay back a bit, and say nothing.The Duke of York is nothingnot consistent. His only real problem is that he is consistent at making bad choices, and perhaps in time the worst of all will be when he decidednotto relinquish his motheraposs hand at the Westminster Abbey memorial for his father, to let her be led to her seat by someone  as he quietly slipped into his own.Instead Andrew kept her hand, eyeballed the Dean of Westminster into backing down, and flaunted the Head of the Church of England in front of a bank of TV cameras in the full knowledge that his fatheraposs memorial would be reduced to a news item re-upping allegations of sexual abuse.Worse than the public criticism, though, was the well-briefed fury of Charles and William, the next two monarchs who will not be as forgiving as the current one. And then the entirely-coincidental revelation that Andrew had not mended his ways, and had become embroiled with another scandal.This time itaposs a court case in which he, his ex-we and both his daughters are alleged to have been the beneficiaries of a grand swindle. A Turkish banker allegedly persuaded a Turkish millionairess to trust her cash to him, and she has told the court that he used the money to buy influence for himself with the Royals.The Turkish banker was applauded at the princeaposs now-defunct Pitch@Palace initiative, and around the same time Andrew received £.m, his ex-we £,, and his daughter Eugenie a further £,.The millionairess says she was told the money was for a passport. Coutts says they were told it was to pay for Beatriceaposs wedding. This is despite the fact a passport costs £., and Beatrice married a millionaire.  Andrew has now repaid the £,, but a further £, is unaccounted for. The Duchess of York has refused toher chunk, on the grounds it was paid for her work as a brand ambassador for a green energy company, even though it does not seem to be benefitting much from the connection. Beatriceaposs friends have described her as completely unaware of how her wedding was paid for, while Eugenie has let it be known she spent the £, on a surprise birthday party for her mother.And the question must now be asked of the entire family: what is it about dodgy money that attracts you Becausea £, bill for a wedding was settled by a Turkish political exile, any other bride would know about it. If any other woman got six-figure sums from her ex-husbandaposs chums she might wonder why. Andany one of us wanted to throw a surprise party and found it cost the same as a new car, weaposd throw a smaller onewe didnapost have the means to pay for it. Now the Royal Family finds itself in the unenviable situation of having paid £.million between them to make a scandal go away, just as the Duke of York manages to drive them smack into a new one - one which makes them look entitled, opportunistic, and desperate for cash to supplement a lestyle they cannot afford.At a time when the rest of the nation knows to the nearest penny what they can afford, and are turning off the heating or adjusting their shopping habits to scrape by, the fact that the future Royal Family canapost imagine a wedding that costs less than three quarters of a million pounds is not going to improve its long-term chances of survival.The timing of this court case, which has rumbled on for a couple of years, suddenly being made public in the week after Andrew embarrassed his relatives is interesting. And it may be linked to the fact that the Duke, who just a few months ago confirmed his public appearance at the memorial would be the last, is now reportedly considering smearing his pudgy chops across the Derby, a Falklands anniversary event, and the Platinum Jubilee. Why would a man who vowed to step away from the spotlight now be so intent on hogging it  Read more Prince Andrew is a true pauper prince - a man of poor wit, poor talent, and poor judgement. All that makes him rich is his title, and after giving up every other honoric his HRH is the one thing he has held onto. He is not allowed to use it, but he does still have it.He also held on to his daughtersapos titles, when other siblings relinquished them in favour of a more normal le. He fought for his daughtersapos Royal security, when it was costing £m a year and creating bad news as Met police officers were forced to trail after two girls on their gap yahs. For all the criticism levelled at Harry and Meghan for trying to trade off their Royal titles, Andrew and Sarah of York have done exactly that for decades, and with far more disastrous consequences. It perhaps explains why sheaposs still Sarah of York. Whoaposd want to change their name,it would cost you the chance to earn £, without having to go down the pit  Having lost his reputation, his ski chalet, millions of pounds and the trust of most of his wider family, Andrew seems to be intent on reinventing himself - not as a changed or chastened man, but as a prince, who needs to show no humility or shame. With the Queen by his side, Andrew can try it. But he has underestimated two things. The first is the fury of the British public, which does not forgive sexual misconduct in public le that easily, still less so when it involves someone legally a child. And the second is the ruthlessness of monarchy - the one quality which has been passed through that family since William the Conqueror. Charles may go easy on his younger brother, but William seems to feel nothing but scorn for playboy princes with dubious means of financial support. There will not be space on William Vaposs balcony for Uncle Andrew, nor much patience with the York familyaposs inability to adjust their lestyle to suit their income. Andrew is therefore working against the clock -being a prince is what turns a buck, then how much of a prince can he be, in the time his mother has left  The answer must be: for as long as her family lets the Queen be so exploited.Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Sarah FergusonPrince Philip, Duke of EdinburghPrince Andrew, Duke of YorkRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news prince-andrews-now-deleted-falklands-"Queen reluctant to have Prince Andrew step back says LevinByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Apr Prince Andrewaposs hastily deleted statement about his experiences in the Falklands War reportedly left royal aides blindsided. On Saturday, a -word post about how he ed from the conflict as a changed man was posted to his ex-we Sarah Fergusonaposs Instagram account. Andrew, who reached a multimillion-pound out-of-court settlement in a civil sexual assault case a few weeks ago, flew missions as a Sea King helicopter pilot during the war, which was  years ago. His reflection appeared in three posts - which were removed after about two hours. Beneath the last post, it said it was written by HRH The Duke of York before the HRH was deleted.  The Queen stripped Andrew of his honorary military roles in January and he gave up his HRH style in a dramatic fallout from his civil sex case. And now, The Times reports that both Buckingham Palace and Andrewaposs team were both unaware his account had been published online and were blindsided by it.In the first Instagram post, Sarah wrote: I asked Andrew this morning for his reflections on the anniversary of his sailing from Portsmouth to the Falkland Islands  years ago. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. Andrewaposs account begins: As I sit here at my desk on this cold crisp spring morning thinking back to April  Iaposve tried to think what was going through my mind as we sailed out of Portsmouth lining the flight deck of HMS INVINCIBLE. The -year-old concluded: So whilst I think back to a day when a young man went to war, full of bravado, I ed a changed man. I put away childish things and  bravado and ed a man full in the knowledge of human frailty and suffering.  My reflection makes me think even harder and pray even more fervently for those in conflict today, for those familyaposstorn apart by the horrors they have witnessed.Like many royal watchers, author Robert Jobson was left baffled by Andrewaposs Falklands statement and is unsure what he hoped to achieve. He told The Mirror: I am not one of those who slam Prince Andrew because it is the latest - and perhaps easiest - media target. But the Duke of York’s bizarre decision to try to bolster his own image by waffling on about his Falklands war experiences on his ex-we’s Instagram account and also use the HRH title that has been stripped from him to sign off was an odd move. He continued: His ramblings about the Falklands - where we accept he fought with courage - shows how out of touch he is. He seems clueless about what people really think of him these days - a far cry from those days as the handsome and feted naval officer and pilot. It is unclearthis was a shameless comeback pitch or a last hurrah - by reminding people that he was once a war hero. But ato public le for the -year-old is not on the palace agenda and it won’t happen. Eventhe Queen has forgiven her favourite son, and believes in him, powerful figures in the palace corridors haven’t. Nor have the public. title: puppy lots love kisses give
story: Puppy with lots of love and kisses to give keeps being overlooked at RSPCAPoodle Mighty Midge is searching for a place to call home after watching all his brothers and sisters leave the RSPCAs Sheffield Animal Centre with their new familiesMighty Midge is currently staying at the RSPCAs Sheffield Animal Centre Image: RSPCAByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Apr |commentsHe has watched all his siblings secure new homes after being rescued by an RSPCA inspector - but is still waiting for his turn.Poodle Mighty Midge, who is no more than three-months-old, was taken to the RSPCAaposs Sheffield Animal Centre by an inspectorate team earlier this year.Despite being a sought-after breed, Mighty Midge hasnapost been able to secure a new home, possibly due to having cherry eye.Unlike humans, dogs have three eyelids rather than two - and their third tear gland can become swollen and red developing into ‘cherry eye’ as it creates a small pink bulge which covers part of the eye.The Blue Cross says ‘cherry eye’ commonly protrudes from the corner of the eye nearest the nose.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories. They said: “Cherry eye is a common condition inherited in certain breeds of dog, and in rare cases, it can arise in cats. “Although unsightly, cherry eye doesn’t normally cause any discomfort to dogs or cats unless it is left untreated and complications occur.” But Mighty Midge wonapost have to suffer with cherry eye for much longer as vets will be correcting his condition when he is old enough to be neutered.  Despite being a tiny puppy, Mighty Midge is said to have a big character and is courageous, adventurous and super friendly with people and other dogs. An RSPCA statement reads: He just wants to please. He is into everything wanting to be involved. He sleeps in his little bed on the floor by the side of my bed all night. He is used to travelling in the car and it sends him to sleep in his carrier. He doesnapost wee or poo now until early morning. He is used to going in the garden but uses puppy pad too. He is a delightful little man with lots of love and kisses to give. We know he is a little dferent but this amazing baby also deserves his forever sofa, just like his siblings have found. The food-loving dog can live with children and other dogs - but still needs to learn that itaposs OK to be alone sometimes. He will need to be taken to training classes to help him grow into a well-rounded adult dog. If youaposre interested in rehoming Mighty Midge, or any other dogs at the RSPCAaposs Sheffield Animal Centre, contact their team on  . The centre is open .pm to .pm every day except Wednesday. Do you have a cute dog story to share  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. news uk-news queen-hold-more-royal-engagements-"Queen’s delight at display of hand-crafted artefacts at WindsorByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Apr |commentsThe Queen will hold more royal engagements from her living room with people coming to see her rather than the monarch travelling to see them, an expert has said.The -year-old has suffered several bouts of ill health recently and is believed to be experiencing problems with her mobility.At Prince Philipaposs memorial service at Westminster Abbey last week, her attendance was only confirmed hours before the event and she entered the Abbey using a walking stick.And according to royal expert Camilla Tominey, people are going to be coming to the Queen rather than her travelling to them.She explained in a video for the: I think weaposre going to see more of the Queen in situ, and she might get to where she needs to be in private and then be photographed on the spot. That being said, we had some lovely photographs last week of an audience in her own living room. Thataposs going to be happening more frequently now. When it comes to the royal diary, theyaposve got to prioritise quality over quantity. However, Camilla did add that there are some events that are sacrosanct in the royal diary, such as Prince Philipaposs memorial service - and for these, the Queen will do all she can to attend. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. Camilla explained: Despite her own discomfort, she was determined to be there. Yes, concessions had to be made to ensure she was as comfortable as possible but itaposs these types of engagements she will move heaven and earth to attend. The monarchy is changing before our very eyes and arguably thataposs no bad thing.  What we think is the Queen isnapost having health problems but mobility problems - she canapost stand for long periods or walk for long distances and therefore accommodations are being made. I think the palace are handling this very much as they did when the Duke of Edinburgh retired and he was able to say which engagements he did or didnapost want to attend at very short notice.In order for the Queen to attend her beloved husbandaposs memorial service last week, military-style plans were put in place to sweep her there in the most comfortable way possible. She was transported from Windsor Castle to Buckingham Palace in a Land Rover, where she then swapped into her State Bentley. The Bentley then made the short journey to the Abbey escorted by police outriders and parked outside the Abbeyaposs discreet Poetsapos Yard entrance, which has fewer steps and is a shorter distance to where she was to sit for the service. Other special arrangements put in place for the Queen’s comfort were the service limited to  minutes and the monarch sitting in one of the Canada chairs but with an additional cushion. news uk-news queens-quick-witted-remark-after-"Queens savage response as photographer asks to remove crownBySofie JacksonVideo News ReporterRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Apr Updated:,  Apr |comments The Queen displayed some sassy quick-wit after being asked to remove her crown during a photoshoot.A resurfaced clip from over a decade ago sees the long-serving monarch decked out in full regal attire for the shoot with photographer Annie Leibovitz.The edited footage, shared to TikTok on Sunday by user @brittoker, has been watched more than , times, reports the Daily Star. The renowned American portrait snapper says in the video: I think it will look better without the crown. It will look better, less dressy, Leibovitz adds. The Queen, who is posing in a fur cape and holding a scepter, laughs and says: Less dressy! What do you think this is   Unfortunately, the clip was edited to make it look like The Queen had stormed out of the room with two servants – but this didnapost happen at all. As later explained by Leibovitz herself, The Queen had been storming into the room and was nervous about the photoshoot. Viewers on TikTok were shocked by the frosty exchange and many believed The Queen should not have been asked to take off her crown. One said: Yeah… you don’t ask the queen to take off her crown.  A second joked: Who asks the queen to remove the crown. Off the tower methinks. Where is your protocol when talking to the queen  said a third outraged viewer. Someone  said: That was either brave or ignorant. I’m not sure which! Defending the photographer, another commented: I mean, Annie Leibovitz is well known for her stripped-back approach, weird choice for a royal portrait. I think she was brave to ask! Talking at her photography exhibition at the National Portrait gallery in , Leibovitz defended The Queen. She recalled: We were all very nervous. The Queen came down the hall and she looked a little perturbed. I knew something was up. All her dressers were about ft away. No one was near her. She was coming down the hall very purposefully. As she came in she said, aposI donapost have much time.apos Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON The QueenRoyal FamilyAnnie Leibovitz" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news six-signs-disgraced-prince-andrew-"Queen reluctant to have Prince Andrew step back says LevinByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Apr It has been more than two years since Prince Andrew sensationally revealed he would be stepping back from public le.His dramatic statement in November  came just days after his disastrous interview on BBC Newsnight, where he spoke atabout his association with the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Earlier this year, Andrew reached an out of court settlement with his accuser Virginia Giuffre in a civil sex claim filed in the US. It means that he avoided a potentially explosive trial with the settlement said to be £million. Andrew has continually denied the allegations against him. In January, he was stripped of his honorary military titles and patronages given to him by the Queen and it looked as though there was no way back for the Duke of York. But despite all this, the Mirroraposs royal editor Russell Myers has previously said that friends of Andrew say he still feels he has a lot to offer public le again. So do these signs below show he is trying to reinvent himself to play a more prominent role in the Royal Family Charity workJust months after Andrew put out a statement, approved by the Queen, that he would be quitting public le, he appeared on his ex-we Sarah Fergusonaposs Instagram account.A series of photos posted on her account in April  showed him putting together care packages for a local Windsor hospice.It led to criticism from royal biographer Tom Bower, who told MailOnline it was rather pathetic that heexploits the coronavirus crisis to creep back into the spotlight.However, fellow royal expert Richard Fitzwilliam did say at the time it was the sort of thing heought to be doing.Interview after Prince Philipaposs death Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. A year after this, the Queenaposs beloved husband and Andrewaposs father Prince Philip died at the age of  at Windsor Castle.In the aftermath of his death, Andrew was one of the first royals to publicly speak on camera about his fatheraposs passing.At a church service several days after Philipaposs death, Andrew said the monarch was feeling it more than everybody  but was remaining incredibly stoic, as he described his fatheraposs death as a terrible loss. It was his first public comment since his Newsnight interview - and just last week it was reported that members of the Royal household were left furious after Prince Andrew’s ‘completely inappropriate’ move right after Philip’s death. A source told the Mirror: “There is definitely a hand being played. “Hewas straight out the blocks in front of the cameras when the Duke of Edinburgh died, which was seen within the family as being completely inappropriate.Supporting victims In February, it was revealed that Andrew had reached a settlement in his civil sex claim.In a statement included in court documents, he expressed his regret at his association with Epstein and also vowed to support sex trafficking victims.It said: Prince Andrew regrets his association with Epstein, and commends the bravery of Ms. Giuffre and other survivors in standing up for themselves and others. “He pledges to demonstrate his regret for his association with Epstein by supporting the fight against the evils of sex trafficking, and by supporting its victims.” And speaking on True Royalty TVaposs The Royal Beat, Mirror royal editor Russell Myers said this could have been Andrewaposs way of positioning himself for ato public le. He explained: “The language used in this [settlement] statement is that Prince Andrew will be helping sex trafficking victims. Is this him positioning himself to try and reinvent himself in the eyes of the public He added: “He is only , but it is impossible to see how he could have any future. His daughter Princess Eugenie founded and helped run a charity for victims of trafficking. Maybe he sees that as an avenue, because possibly his family are the only ones who think they can help him at this stage.” Philipaposs memorial One of the most high-profile events Andrew has attended in recent years is Prince Philipaposs memorial service, which took place last week at Westminster Abbey.It had been revealed in advance he would be attending the service in honour of his late father - and the order of service seemed to suggest he would arrive alongside his daughters Princess Beatrice and Princess Eugenie.However, he ended up taking on a prominent role at the event by walking into the Abbey with his mother the Queen and escorting her to her seat.It was later reported that the Queen defiantly overruled heirs Prince Charles and Prince William to allow her disgraced son Andrew to have a special role at the ceremony.The Prince of Wales and Duke of Cambridge “on more than one occasion” raised their concerns over the optics of allowing the shamed Duke of York to accompany his mother to the Westminster Abbey service last Tuesday. The future kings were “absolutely united” that it was “simply unnecessary” for Andrew to position himself as the only family member to escort the Queen to the church. But well placed sources have confirmed the -year-old monarch told them it was “her wish and final decision” that Andrew should chaperone her into the Abbey. Falklands War post  Meanwhile, this weekend, an account of Andrewaposs experience during the Falklands War was posted to his ex-we Fergieaposs Instagram account.Andrew flew missions as a Sea King helicopter pilot during the conflict and his reflection appeared in three posts - which were removed after about two hours. Beneath the last post, it said it was written by HRH The Duke of York before the HRH was deleted. The Queen stripped Andrew of his honorary military roles in January and he gave up his HRH style in a dramatic fallout from his civil sex case. At the time, a royal source said Andrew, who was born a HRH, will not use it in any official capacity. Like many royal watchers, author Robert Jobson was left baffled by Andrewaposs Falklands statement and is unsure what he hoped to achieve.  He tells The Mirror: I am not one of those who slam Prince Andrew because it is the latest - and perhaps easiest - media target. But the Duke of York’s bizarre decision to try to bolster his own image by waffling on about his Falklands war experiences on his ex-we’s Instagram account and also use the HRH title that has been stripped from him to sign off was an odd move. His ramblings about the Falklands - where we accept he fought with courage - shows how out of touch he is. He seems clueless about what people really think of him these days - a far cry from those days as the handsome and feted naval officer and pilot. It is unclearthis was a shameless comeback pitch or a last hurrah - by reminding people that he was once a war hero. But ato public le for the -year-old is not on the palace agenda and it won’t happen. Eventhe Queen has forgiven her favourite son, and believes in him, powerful figures in the palace corridors haven’t. Nor have the public. Derby Day appearance  Later this year a bumper four-day bank holiday weekend is planned for June with several events planned to celebrate the Queenaposs Platinum Jubilee.One of those events is the Derby, where it is hoped the Queen will attend.And according to royal sources, Andrew will accompany his mother to the event and act as her chaperone.A source told the Sun: “He was meant to stay invisible during the Platinum Jubilee so there is no way he will be at events like Trooping the Colour. “But the Queen needs a chaperone on all occasions at the moment due to her mobility issues and Andrew has earmarked the Derby as the one he will accompany her at. “He just doesn’t seem to understand the public outcry.”Read MoreRead More Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Prince Andrew, Duke of YorkRoyal FamilyQueen" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: unloved dog who didnt human
story: Unloved dog who didnt have human contact for two years searching for new homeBorder collie Ellie is looking for a new loving home after being rescued from a hellhole by the RSPCA alongside  other dogs - she is learning how to socialize with peopleEllie is searching for a new home Image: RSPCA Triangle NewsByLottie Tiplady-Bishop Paige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Apr |commentsShe didnapost come into contact with a human for the first two years of her le - but is now searching for a loving home after being rescued by the RSPCA. Border collie Ellie has been learning how to socialise with people after being trapped inside a ramshackle barn.The three-year-old dog was rescued by RSPCA workers from the hellhole along with  other dogs, in January last year.The pack of pups were riddled with parasites and struggling for food in Ceredigion, mid Wales.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories. Their owner agreed to work with the RSPCA when “the situation got out of control” meaning they couldn’t meet the dogs’ basic needs. It’s Ellie may have never even been outside, let alone interacted with humans before. But the poor pup has faced further heartbreak since, with her search for a forever home being unsuccessful. Ellie has spent more than  days searching for a new owner.  She is now one of RSPCA Cymru’s longest-staying dogs at their Bryn-y-Maen centre, along with five-year-old crossbreed Charlie, from the same rescue. Charlie was so terried when he was taken into the charity’s Newport centre that he spent the first six weeks of his stay cowering in the corner of his kennel. Bryn-y-Maen’s manager, Victoria Williams, said: “When Ellie arrived at the centre she was unsocialised and understandably nervous. “She’d been living rough in inappropriate conditions in a dilapidated outhouse with  other dogs and had never experienced a normal le, so we’ve worked really hard to build up her trust and confidence.  “For the first couple of months we’d sit outside her kennel and throw in high value treats for. “Once she was comfortable with that we fed her through the kennel bars before letting her out in the main block, leaving food bowls in dferent areas and gradually introducing more staff around her. “The next step was to get her used to a collar and a lead, and about three months after she arrived, she was finally ready to go for a walk. “It was really important not to rush Ellie and to let her do everything at her own pace. “We took in five other dogs from the same farm and whilst they have all been rehomed since, Ellie is still waiting. “She’s been with us a long time and has seen her friends from the barn all go off to new families, so we’d really love to see her settled and happy in her own home after everything she’s been through.” Ellie will need a quiet rural or semi rural environment with understanding owners who are going to be able to continue to build her confidence in an adult-only home as the only pet. Do you have a dog story to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. title: violent huggy wuggy clips see
story: Violent Huggy Wuggy clips see kids imitate monster as schools issue warning to parentsCregagh Primary School in East Belfast has warned parents that children have been mimicking the horror video, which shows a creepy character singing about hugging and killingParents have been warned over the terrying Huggy Wuggy bear as young kids are copying the videos Image: You tubeByJane CorscaddenLucy SkouldingFreelance writer:,  Apr |commentsA school has issued an urgent warning to parents as young pupils have been watching videos featuring a character called Huggy Wuggy from a horror game and then mimicking the clips. One Belfast school said children have been accessing the upsetting videos, which feature a razor-toothed monster from the video game Poppy Playtime, through YouTube and TikTok. One clip shows the creepy Huggy Wuggy singing about hugging and killing and asking viewers to take their last breath - and itaposs worrying parents whose children have been copying the video while in the school playground, reports Belfast Live.Cregagh Primary School in East Belfast warned parents of the trend and asked them to be vigilant around what children are watching.  In a post on the schoolaposs Facebook page, principal David Hegarty said: It has been brought to my attention that a character named aposHuggy Wuggyapos is being viewed by our children online, some as young as Primary One. The character can be easily viewed on YouTube channels and is a teddy bear with razor sharp teeth that sings worrying songs about hugging and killing.On one of the videos the bear asks the viewer to take their last breath. It is a very deceiving characters, as hugs should be seen as something kind and loving, and because of its name is able to infiltrate firewalls and filters. I just wanted to inform parents so you are aware and can be vigilant around what your children could be watching.The same post was also shared to the Facebook page of Abbotaposs Cross Primary School in Newtownabbey. One mum told Sky News her three-year-old son tried to jump out a window believing heaposd die and come back to le like Huggy Wuggy does after watching the creepy videos.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON YouTubeEducationSchools" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news bride-gets-wedding-manicure-its-"TikTok user says she paid  for ‘crooked’ nailsByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Apr |commentsYour wedding day is supposed to be one of the best days of your le, so of course, youaposll want to look and feel your best. With that in mind, one lady scheduled an appointment eight hours before she was due to walk down the aisle with a celebrity tech - and paid £ for the honour.But when she walked out of the salon, she was so horried she had to share the results on her TikTok @crybabynails.In a video that has since been viewed , times, she documented the entire process from start to finish and weaposre not sure where it went wrong. My wedding is in  hours and I tried a new nail tech, she wrote across the clip. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. She insisted my finger is crooked not the nail. I paid  and a  water bottle fee. I’m so upset what should I do  she said. After being filed, buffed, and painted, the bride-to-be was left with ombre beige and white nails which were in an upside-down triangular shape - one of which had little flowers on. But apparently, this wasnapost what she wanted...Since being posted, the video has been liked more than , times and has received  comments from stunned viewers who were shocked by the final result. One person said: Cancel the wedding at this point. Another wrote: Please tell me this is a joke. Girl dispute it with the bank, said a third. Someone  said: My OCD over the crooked one, with laughing face emojis, to which the bride replied with: She said it was my finger.Others who werenapost so sure about the shape of the nail were quick to blame the technician but it turns out the woman had requested it. I mean why did you pick duck nails lol, one viewer said. And the bride was quick to shut them down saying: Cause I like them  In fact, sheaposs been seen sporting this particular style in a number of other previous videos on her page.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. story: Couple given unrealistic £ weekly food budget spark debate on cost of livingA couple on a very low income with three cats were told it was possible to spend just £ on a weekly food shop - sparking a heated debate online about reasonable budgetingDo you think a £ weekly food shop is doable  Let us know your thoughts in the comments section below Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByLiam GilliverOpinion Writer:,  Apr |comments A debate has sparked online after a couple on a low income were told it would be possible to spend just £ a week on food for them and their three cats.Taking to Mumsnet to discuss her finances, an anonymous woman explained that she and her partner are on a aposvery low incomeapos and have been hit hard by the rising fuel prices. She wrote: We are two adults, middle-aged, with three cats. Very low income. Whataposs the cheapest food bill we could budget  Weaposre not veggie vegan, no food allergies or intolerances. I think weaposre spending too much. More than  people responded to the post. however, opinions were ided after several users suggested a weekly food bill of £ was more than enough to feed the couple and their furry friends.  Want the latest news and expert money-saving advice  Share your email for the biggest finance headlines, tips and more from the Mirror One person replied: £ £ should be perfectly doable for at least a short time. Another said: I agree, £ £. But someone  disagreed, asking: What the heck do people eat for £- a week for two  Me and my partner spend £-£ and I thought we did quite well to be honest! A fourth proclaimed: £  is completely unrealistic, sorry. It’s me and two cats and I struggle to keep under £ . A dferent user wrote: What on earth would you buy in order to feed three cats and two adults on such a small amount of money  We spend probably half that per week on three cats alone, and we definitely donapost buy expensive high-end food.  Last month, a mum-of-three revealed how she bagged £ worth of supermarket food for just £ using an online shopping app.-year-old Jessica Pennington is a frequent user of the Too Good To Go app, which sells aposmagic bagsapos of food that would otherwise be thrown out at the end of the day, for a discounted price. Using the app, Jessica says she once got a bag full of Spar food worth £ for just £., as well as a Too Good To Go haul from Cinnabon worth £ for only £.. Prices of the aposmagic bagsapos start from just £. However, Too Good To Go users cannot choose what specic products theyaposre given.Speaking to LatestDeals - the Accounts Assistant said: “I heard about the Too Good To Go app through adverts on social media so I started giving it a go and now we tend to use it once a week.If you have a chest freezer, then definitely utilise this app - so much can be frozen!Do you think a weekly food shop of £ is doable  Let us know your thoughts in the comments section below.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON ViralFood" data-immediate"data-immediate"Serve the food you really want to eat by signing up for our tips and recipes and never be bored by your cooking againSign UpInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news im-terried-haunted-house-wont-"CCTV captures moment cat sees ghost in familys homeByJulia BanimAudience WriterNia Price:,  Apr |comments A aposfreaked outapos mum has confessed that sheaposs now too scared to enter the basement of her haunted house alone after creepy CCTV footage shows what she believes to be a ghost chasing her cat.Kathy Gallinger, , claims to have experienced a number of eerie occurrences ever since she first moved into her home back in August . This has included objects moving around on their own and eerie shadowy figures appearing from the darkness. However, one incident, in particular, has scared her more than any of the others.After setting up a CCTV camera in her basement, Kathy, from Quinte West, Ontario, Canada, captured footage of what appears to be a black mass chasing her petried cat, Salem, after emerging from her motheraposs old s doll.The video shows three-year-old Salem staring in the direction of the doll prior to the black mist emerging, looking to be in visible distress. The mass then drts towards him, causing him to flee in apparent terror. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Kathy, who works as a call centre operator, says she has become used to the spooky goings-on at her home scaring the le out of her, and claims sheaposs even avoided going down into the basement by herself at all costs. Some have suggested that the family had digitally edited the chilling footage, but Kathy states that they work hard to debunk anything captured on CCTV, and is insistent that the footage is real. Kathy explained: My husband and I were really freaked out. I immediately called my psychic medium friend and she made me feel a little better because she said she wasnapost getting any vibes where itaposs something thataposs out to get us, itaposs just something that wants its presence known. I think my house must be haunted. I love this house. The only way weaposd consider moving wasit became violent oranything was to harm any of us, of course. But as it stands right now, other than a few things moving and just scaring the le out of us, weaposve become used to it really. The mum-of-one says her daughter Jayden Carveth, , was the one to convince her to share the ghostly goings-on at her house via TikTok, where she has since clocked up more than , followers and likes.Kathy said: My TikTok followers asked to put the camera in with the dolls overnight in the basement as thataposs where most of the activity is. The cat was down there and my daughteraposs bedroom is down there and she said the cat ran to her door. She heard him outside and let him in and he was clearly afraid of something. She said aposmum, you might want to check those cameras because the cataposs crazy scaredapos.  She continued: The next day we checked the cameras and what I saw was my cat staring at these dolls clearly frightened of something and then all of a sudden a black mass or mist formed from one of the dolls. I think it could be a ghost. Salem is my protector. That cat goes everywhere with me soI do have to go downstairs and Iaposm nervous, he follows me. Itaposs uncommon for him to show signs of being afraid like that. Kathy says a psychic told her that the paranormal activity is connected to an incident that happened back in the s after a group of teenagers possibly used a ouija board at the house. A week or two can go by without any happenings. However, over the course of the last fortnight. the house is said to have become aposvery activeapos, which a friend suggested could be on account of the upcoming Easter holiday.Kathy added: We started noticing little things right away when we moved in. Iaposd get up in the morning and two or three kitchen cupboards would be open and back then we didnapost even have security cameras set up and Iaposd blame my husband and would be like aposyou got up in the night and didnapost shut these cabinetsapos and he was like aposno I wasnapost up in the nightapos. Or Iaposd look for my hairbrush which I keep in the upstairs bathroom and find it in our basement and my daughter was like aposI didnapost take the brush down thereapos. It wasnapost until one night we were sitting in our bedroom, I was reading a book and my closet doors started opening and closing by themselves. Thataposs when my husband was like aposok, something weird is going on hereapos. Weaposve lived here four years and had a lot of spooky stuff happen and weaposve seen a lot of scary stuff - shadows figures even, but nothing has ever physically touched or harmed us.Do you have a ghost-related story to share  We pay for stories. news weird-news i-splashed-out-eyelash-extensions-"TikToker horried by results of eyelash extensionsByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Apr |comments When it comes to our faces there are numerous ways we can alter our appearance, from skilful make-up application to beauty treatments and cosmetic procedures.These days many people like to get their eyebrows and lashes done, tinting and adding extensions. However, it seems you might want to do your research before opting for the latter as one woman has shared her horrendous experience.A TikTok user named Dakota Treacy has gone viral after sharing the botched eyelash extensions she recently paid for - claiming she went through hell and was left in pain. Posting under the name @deeeeeee, Dakota shared a look at what she had hoped her eyelashes would look like and how they actually turned out. Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.Dakota was given huge fake eyelashes, which had been stuck to her lid with a ridiculous amount of glue. She described it as feeling like superglue had been applied to her eye. Itaposs so much worse than it even looked in the video, she explained. Now they look bad, but they donapost look too bad, butyou actually look in closer, under my eye, all of the remnants of glue - she obviously used so much glue. It feels literally on my eyes like she used superglue. Iaposve had eyelash extensions before, done very very very well and Iaposve never been in this amount of pain or have experienced this before ever. In a follow-up video, she continued: My le has been hell the last couple of days - Iaposve been in so much pain. Thousands of people took to the comments to share their horror over the extensions, with one lash technician warning that Dakota could lose her eyelashesshe tried to pull the glue off herself. Thankfully Dakota was able to find a professional who could fix the mess and give her the dream extensions sheaposd wanted all along. She added: My new lash tech who was so gentle and kind and patient - it took her  minutes with the solution and whatever to get those things off my eyes. She saved my eyelashes -Iaposd have kept them on any longer I probably wouldnapost have any eyelashes left. For some miraculous reason my eyelashes werenapost damaged, she put. anew set on and they are so nice and honestly, thataposs what I was going for - I didnapost want to look like f***ing Eugene Levy. Dakota finished the video by sharing that she had tried to complain to the original woman, but had been blocked. She went on to advise others to do their research before getting extensions.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: loch ness monster evidence caught
story: Loch Ness Monster evidence caught on camera but spotters just miss the beastWarren Speed and Jamie Huntley were making a documentary about Nessie and were amazed when they spotted the beast, but it disappeared again before they could focus their cameraWarren Speed and Jamie Huntley spotted Nessie while making a documentaryByJohn BettAudience WriterAndy Crick:,  Apr |comments The Loch Ness Monster was spotted by a film crew making a documentary about the beast - but it disappeared before they could focus their camera.Warren Speed and Jamie Huntley said they saw Nessie with their own eyes and described it as being around five metres inwith having a whale-like hump. Jamie, , tried to whip out his camera to get a photo of the beast but it ducked under the surface before he got the chance to get a picture.Warren and Jamieaposs sighting is the second time Nessie has been spotted this year, as an aposexpertapos recorded an official sighting after spotting apostwo objects moving parallel to each otherapos.What do you think about the Loch Ness Monster  Let us know in the comments...Producer and filmmaker Warren, of Newbiggin-by-the-Sea, Northumberland, said: Unbelievable as this sounds, me and Jamie saw something very large in the loch. I saw something like a very large upturned boat out of the corner of my eye about m away from the shoreline, then Jamie shouted stop. He saw it fully and said it looked like a very dark whale - a hump. By the time I stopped the car, a few metres later, trees were covering our view, I quickly reversed, Jamie jumped out.  But all he got on his phone camera were very large circular ripples, but in the exact spot the aposcreatureapos had been. And as we watched it looked like ‘it’ was moving away from us underwater before totally disappearing a few moments later. If we had arrived literally  seconds earlier, we would have caught this properly on camera. We were absolutely gutted that we missed what would have been a genuinely historic picture. “But also amazed at what we had both seen as we were both very sceptical about previous sightings.  As we are actually here in Loch Ness filming a documentary on all of the strange occurrences in the area, we expect ridicule and disbelief but we both know exactly what we saw. Nessie hunter Steve Feltham, who we met later in the day, agreed our experience sounded and looked like a genuine sighting similar to others over the years. And Jamie has logged it with the Register of Nessie sightings. Jamie, of Gateshead, added: I looked towards then cemetery and then the large object or creature in the loch caught my eye. At first I thought it was a big boulder or something, I said to my friend driving ‘Whataposs that itaposs huge ’ The object creature was reflecting the water so looked wet, almost like a whale skin crossed with a fish skin, it was dark in colour - darker than the water surrounding it. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. There were dark greys, black, browns in colour, it almost looked like how a whale hump might look breaking the surface minus the fin. There was a definite movement but didnapost see too much of the movement before trees obscured it, it was a very big size at least  foot long, maybe bigger, around the middle of the loch. The earliest sighting of the monster was recorded by Saint Columba in . But Nessiemania really took hold in  when George Spicer and his we claimed a ft-long beast crossed the road in front of his car. A year later, the famous surgeonaposs photograph appeared to show Nessieaposs head and neck poking out of the water. It is now believed to be a hoax. Nessie hunters have flocked to the waterside ever since. title: mum gives birth surprise baby
story: Exclusive: Mum gives birth to surprise baby in shower after suffering stomach painDimitty Bonnet, , got the shock of her le when she gave birth alone in the shower - having had no idea she was pregnant - despite having been pregnant twice beforeThe mum thought shed put on a few pounds in lockdown Image: Dimitty SWNSByRosaleen FentonDeputy Features EditorEllie Fawcett:,  Apr Updated:,  Apr |comments A woman got the shock of her le when she gave birth alone in the shower - having had no idea she was pregnant.Already a mum-of-two, Dimitty Bonnet, , had given up hopes of having another child and was left utterly stunned when she felt the sudden urge to push while showering before catching the babyaposs head between her legs.Dimitty and her husband, Jason, , a signwriter - who are parents to Nate, five, and Darci, three - had stopped trying to have any more children after concluding their family was complete. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here During her pregnancy, she had regular periods and even did a negative pregnancy test a few weeks before the surprise birth at :am on th February .Jason was in bed at the time, and as she called out for help he rushed into the bathroom to find his we covered in blood and holding a baby. She had no idea that anything was wrong until she started to feel aposa bit offapos the evening before she gave birth.Dimitty, an admin manager, from Campbelltown, New South Wales, Australia, said: “My weight has fluctuated my whole le, so I didn’t think anything of it when I put on a few pounds. I assumed it was just a bit of lockdown weight, and it was nothing too noticeable. “I’d flown on a plane a month before, and even had an x-ray after a rugby injury six weeks before I gave birth. There was no part of me that thought I could be expecting - to be sure I even took a test a month before giving birth and it came back negative. “The evening before he was born, I just felt a bit yuck. My stomach felt a bit off, so I put the kids to bed and got an early night myself.“I woke up around am and felt so uncomfortable. It was like I really needed the toilet, but I wasn’t able to go. “The pain started to get worse, so I decided to have a shower to make myself feel better. “I didn’t want to wake my husband, so I kept the light off and showered in the dark. “I felt a sudden urge to push, and the next thing I knew, I was holding a baby’s head.” In a state of shock and confusion, Dimitty managed to sit down on the floor in the dark, and after a final push, her baby was born in the early hours of February th .She called for her husband, Jason, who rushed into the bathroom and was shocked to find his we cradling their newborn son. The panicked pair called for an ambulance, which arrived around  minutes later – just in time to help Dimitty deliver the placenta. After the paramedics cut the cord and made sure that mum and baby were okay, they took the family to Campbelltown Hospital, New South Wales, where the pair were monitored for  hours. Dimitty and Jason named their surprise baby boy, Harvey Eric Barry Timmins. He weighed lbs oz.  Whilst Dimitty was in the hospital, they face-timed Nate and Darci, telling them that aposMummy has a surprise before showing them their new sibling. They were both over the moon. “It was such a huge shock that the first few days are a bit of a blur,” Dimitty said. “My older kids were so excited when we told them, particularly my daughter as she’s always wanted to be a big sister. She’s so caring and has taken on her new role really well. “Our family and friends have all been so supportive as we weren’t prepared at all – in fact we’d thrown away all our old baby stuff a month before. “But everyone came together to make sure we had a pram, clothes, nappies, and a bed for him. “It took us about  hours to come up with a name for him, but we chose Harvey after Jason’s grandfather, which is really special. “My other two pregnancies were so dferent so I never thought something like this could happen to me. Itaposs taken my brain and body a bit of time to process whataposs happened, but we are finding our feet and feeling more settled now. “He’s such an amazing baby and we feel so lucky to have him join the family, evenit was quite a shock at first.” Her husband Jason added: Heaposs a precious little man but it was the biggest shock of my le. news weird-news mum-left-unrecognisable-kids-after-"Mum spends £ on Droopy eyelids treatmentByJohn BettAudience WriterRebecca Cooley:,  Apr |comments A mum paid £ for an eye treatment to fix her aposdroopingapos eyelids but it didnapost go as planned and soon her whole face aposballoonedapos - leaving her unrecognisable, even to her own kids.Mariana Janse, , went in for plasma fibroblast therapy, where a device zaps a high-frequency electric current through the skin to encourage tissue regeneration. She hoped it would apostake some years offapos and she had the treatment done before parentaposs evening at her -year-old sonaposs school. But after the treatment Mariana, from Northampton, East Midlands, took a turn for the worse and her face swelled up - and when she went to the school her son couldnapost recognise her. What do you think of the treatment  Let us know in the comments...Mariana, from Northampton, East Midlands, said: I wanted to take a couple of years off, hoping Iaposd look like I was turning  instead of . Iaposve got really droopy eyelids on the top and they literally hang on my eyelashes and I can see it - so itaposs not just looking at it, it literally annoys me for my vision. Iaposve also got excess skin and dark circles under my eyes so I was hoping that would help tighten the skin a little bit because itaposs dficult to put make-up on because thereaposs so much skin.Right after I just had red skin and little dots but when I woke up the next morning it was really, really swollen. On the second day I woke up it was super swollen everywhere - top and bottom - and then as the day progressed and the next day the swelling stayed but then my eyes became quite droopy as well. I knew what I was expecting but it was still a shock waking up and realising aposIaposve got to go to parentsapos evening and face my childaposs teachers looking like thatapos.  The teachers asked meI had an allergic reaction and I said aposno Iaposm just trying to look youngerapos. The mum-of-four says she couldnapost help but laugh about her extremely swollen eyes and having to face the teachers on parentsapos evening just one day after the appointment. Most of her family also found it funny, but she says her -year-old son seemed to uncover an unknown phobia, with the sight of the burnt dots around her eyes made him feel aposuncomfortableapos. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. This left the teen unable to be in the same room as his mum for a few days and still unable to look at her face on Motheraposs Day. Mariana said: My family thought it was really funny but my son must have a fear of holes or something because he literally couldnapost even look at me or be in the same room as me. It made him feel really uncomfortable and it was funny because it was Motheraposs Day on Sunday and he was worried about how he was going to spend it with me, looking like that. Luckily some of the spots had gone by then and he could at least be in the same room as me evenhe couldnapost look at me. The anti-ageing treatment works by targeting the collagen and protein-producing cells in the skin, stimulating them and causing the area to tighten up. The hot current creates small holes in the skin’s layer which have to be allowed to heal properly to avoid complications like scarring and pigmentation. news weird-news ted-farm-dog-feeds-orphaned-"Labrador Ted feeds an orphaned lamb with a bottle of milkByNia DaltonSpecialist WriterLucy Notarantonio:,  Apr |comments An adorable friendship has blossomed on a farm in Somerset, after Ted the working dog stepped up to help feed an orphaned lamb named Frank.Black Labrador Ted jumped at the opportunity to balance the bottle of milk in between his teeth, and remained very still and calm while six-week-old lamb Frank suckled. Frank has been hand reared by farmer, Libbie Harris, , from Bristol, since he was born, as his mother didnapost have enough milk to feed him. But with two other lambs to feed, Libbie decided to teach Ted how to muck in - and he couldnapost be a cuter helping hand. to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories. In the video, Ted can be seen on his best behaviour, holding the bottle in the perfect spot while Frank tucks into his milk. Libbie explained: Ted is trained as a gun dog so he learnt how to pick things up with his mouth. I have to feed the lambs three times a day and realised I needed some help. Ted usually picks up pheasants when we go shooting so I thought I’d give it a go. He was able to hold the bottle straight away butit’s full its a bit too heavy. Now I give him the bottle to hold when it’s half empty then I can feed the other two at the same time. It is handy having extra help! The clever seven-year-old Lab has taken on the father role at the farm, and Libbie coins herself a apossurrogate mumapos to the orphaned lambs. She adds: I have eight working dogs but Ted is the most relaxed of the bunch. He likes to chill out and Frank will usually skip around him. I have hand reared Frank who is also known as fragile Frank as he was pretty weak when he was born. His mum had two lambs but not enough milk to feed them so it was better for his chance of survival to be hand reared. He is now thriving and loving le with his friend Ted.Ted isnapost the only farm dog going above and beyond to help orphaned animals - rescue dog Snow has become best friends with the foster calves.From playing to sleeping, eating and even snuggling, thereaposs absolutely nothing Snow wonapost do to stop the sweet baby cows from feeling sad and alone. Owner Krysten Pierre, , from Victoria, Australia, said: Part of me thinks that because Snow was orphaned and moved from home to home too, he kind of understands how the cows feel.Do you have a dog story to tell  Contact nia.dalton@reachplc.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TeamDogsDogsAnimalsPregnancy" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman explains how pronounce pretty
story: Woman explains how to pronounce her pretty name - as everyone gets it wrongA woman with a unique name says nobody ever knows how to correctly pronounce it, so shes made a video for her followers on social media that explains how to say itAbcde Elaine Sutton said people are always pronouncing her name wrong Image: @ abcde.elaineByJohn BettAudience WriterSofie JacksonVideo News Reporter:,  Apr |comments A woman has taken to TikTok to explain how to pronounce her aposprettyapos name - as everyone gets it wrong.Abcde Elaine Sutton said she can see how people get confused, as not many people are named after the first five letters of the alphabet.She said that people go with aposobesityapos, aposab-cityapos, or just aposalphabetapos, but now sheaposs corrected them as all of those are wrong, as the Daily Star reports.Abcde said that her name is actually pronounced aposAbsidyapos, which makes senseyou think about it, and soon her followers on social media were saying how much they liked the name. What do you think about Abcdeaposs unique name  Let us know in the comments...Since the video was uploaded to TikTok on March  it has been watched two million times and thousands of people have commented with even more questions for Abcde. One person said: Was it your parents that went viral when they named you that  I remember that a long time ago. A second wrote: No way thereaposs actually someone with this name. I read about it years ago. Cool man. Okay but it’s actually a pretty name, said a third user. Someone who clearly disagreed said: Not tryna be mean but itaposs not unique, itaposs the alphabet. This has got to be the worse name I’ve ever heard, said another even less kind person.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere.Meanwhile, a woman has hit back at trolls who slammed the name she chose for her first child - as they wanted to know what she would have chosen for a girlTikTok star Jasmine Chiswell is social-media famous thanks to her work as a Marilyn Monroe lookalike, but she caused a stir with her fans after sharing her sonaposs name.Jasmine and her husband, Maverick McNeilly, named their son Midnight, and she received countless negative comments and messages about the choice. Now she has taken to social media to share the names she would have chosenshe was having a girl, to take ownership of the issue away from internet bullies. story: Woman shares tests every man must pass to date her - including paying the billA woman has ided opinions online after she posted a video to TikTok of all the tests a guy shes dating has to pass in order for her to see a potential future with themGabby reveals all Image: respectfullygabby TiktokByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Apr |commentsA woman has sparked a debate online after she revealed she plays tests on men she dates to seetheyaposre able to provide and protect her.Gabby shared her strict dating rules on her TikTok, @respectfullygabby, where she said she deliberately gives her potential partners subtle suggestions to seethey pass the test.In a video that has been viewed more than , times, she explained that her first goal is to seethe man offers to pay for their first date. Let’s stop this conversation and the back and forth,   bullsh**t, first date he needs to be paying  per cent, she said. She revealed thatthey donapost pay the full bill sheaposll be running in the opposite direction.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Another test of Gabbyaposs is seeingher dates care about her apossafetyapos. She recalled a time when she booked an Uber to get home after having a few drinks with a guy at a bar in Miami, Florida. The manaposs Uber arrived first she said, and instead of leaving, he offered to wait with her until hers arrived, but Gabby declined. She said: If you don’t care about my safety and making sure I get into my Uber safely, you’re done.This man failed my protection test, and he never heard from me again. Men, you need to be walking her to her car, to her Uber, to wherever to make sure she gets home safely. The third test involves Gabby saying sheaposs aposcoldapos to seeher date will lend his coat to keep her warm. I wanna seeyou will give me the shirt off your back, andyou don’t, you’re dead to me, she said.Since being posted, the video has racked up more than , likes and  comments, many from people who agreed with her rules and said they were common sense. One person said: The girls who get it, GET IT. Another wrote: If a guy doesn’t make sure I get home safely after our date, I won’t go out with him again, no matter how good the date was. A third commented: He needs to pay for every date!! I’ve never paid in my entire le.Someone  put: Normally I don’t agree with tests because it’s all about being sincere..but this is just common sense stuff to look out for the lady your with. But not everyone agreed with Gabby, as one viewer wrote: Men don’t need to provide and protect for every single woman that they meet. Youaposre confusing a st date with a husband or serious boyfriend. And another added: Test this test that. What are we in high school  Stop with the games and communicate!! Way too grown for all this.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _JS.jpg" data-tracking"whatsapp|share|top"|commentsElon Musk - the worldaposs richest man - is set to join Twitteraposs board after becoming the social media aposs top shareholder. It comes after the Tesla and SpaceX chief purchased a . per cent stake - worth billion- in Twitter Inc yesterday. Prior to announcing the purchase, Musk had criticised the micro-blogging site for failing to adhere to free speech principles and said he was contemplating building a new social media . But now the -year-old businessman cannot become the owner of more than .% of Twitteraposs common stock either as an inidual shareholder or a member of a group as long as he is a director of the brand, according to a company filing made today. Twitter Chief Executive Officer Parag Agrawal - who Musk previously ridiculed - said: Iaposm excited to share that weaposre appointing @elonmusk to our board.  In a tweet he added: Heaposs both a passionate believer and intense critic of the service which is exactly what we need on @Twitter, and in the boardroom, to make us stronger in the long-term. In response, Musk tweeted: Looking forward to working with Parag  Twitter board to make signicant improvements to Twitter in coming months. He recently ran a Twitter poll asking usersthey believed the  adheres to the principle of free speech. After disclosing his stake on Monday, Musk put out another poll on Twitter asking usersthey want an edit button, a long-awaited feature on which the social media  has been working. You can never underestimate Elon Musk. I wonder what the underlying motives are  said Gerald Goldberg, CEO of GYL Financial Synergies, a registered investment adviser, whose clients own both Twitter and Tesla shares. I think heaposs sending a message to the SEC that says, aposIaposm going to do what I want to doapos.  On Monday, Musk disclosed his ownership of . million Twitter shares, which are held by the Elon Musk Revocable Trust, of which he is the sole trustee. Musk will participate in the director benefits arrangements applicable to non-employee directors, the company said. Twitter will enter into its standard form of indemnication agreement with Musk, it added. Musk will serve as a Class II director, with the term expiring at Twitteraposs  annual meeting of stockholders. Twitter shares surged six per cent in trading before the opening bell, after closing up over  per cent on Monday.  The South African-Canadian entrepreneur - who in recent months has seen his wealth overtake Amazon founder Jeff Bezos - has said he is a free speech absolutist. He has been vocal against Web, a term for a utopian version of the internet that is decentralised and whose commercial backbone is the non-fungible token . Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey and Musk, though active proponents of cryptocurrencies, share skepticism around the metaverse, NFTs and Web, what some deem to be the evolution of the internet. Musk has previously called NFT profile pictures annoying. The worldaposs richest man will also be a board member of UFC-owner Endeavor until June  but has exited the board of tech non-profit OpenAI, which he co-founded, in . He is also the founder and CEO of SpaceX, and leads brain-chip startup Neuralink and infrastructure firm the Boring Company.
